verses.roman:
sei dui eka ebe caitanya gosāñi
rasa āsvādite doṅhe hailā eka-ṭhāṅi

synonyms: sei—these; dui—two; eka—one; ebe—now; caitanya gosāñi—Lord Caitanya Mahāprabhu; rasa—mellow; āsvādite—to taste; doṅhe—the two; hailā—have become; eka-ṭhāṅi—one body.
translation: Now, to enjoy rasa, They have appeared in one body as Lord Caitanya Mahāprabhu.
